intro: Korthalsella papuana, commonly known as the Papuan korthalsella, is a flowering plant native to Papua, Indonesia. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the fruits are typically small and round. Korthalsella papuana is often found in humid, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in shaded, moist conditions.
